intro: Eustephiopsis marginata, commonly known as the marginate stephania, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fabaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its delicate, trifoliate leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
